fields.description:
h4. Problem:
After configuring the schedule build trigger for any time ending with 05min (e.g. 12:05 AM), if you try to edit the time it will not correctly load the minutes to the form if the time saved before is ending with 05min. It only happens in this case.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Go to *(your plan) >> Actions >> Plan configuration >> Triggers
# Create a new trigger of type *Scheduled*
# Set the time for *12:05 AM* and click *Done*
# Edit the time again and observe the from with the wrong result loaded *12:00 AM*
fields.summary: Scheduled trigger time editor is not correctly loading previously configured time
Enable and disable agents over REST API

fields.description: As a team who have recently moved from TeamCity to Bamboo, one of the things we really miss is the ability to be able to see if there are any pending changes which have been committed and are waiting to be built.  We also use Bitbucket for our repository so surely there can be an easy integration between the two to show this?
fields.summary: Ability to see pending changes needing built

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In 5.14 we introduced a feature that allows plan branches to override just the branch, while the rest of the configuration is inherited (rather than copied) from the master plan. This feature however now *only* supported for Git, Bitbucket Server (Stash) and Subversion repository types.
h3. Suggested Solution

This improvement request exists to have the same functionality in the other repository types provided by Bamboo such as GitHub, CVS and Perforce.
fields.summary: Improve other repository types such as GitHub to make use of linked repository inheritance

{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
There are duplicate data in the table ACL_OBJECT_IDENTITY and ACL_ENTRY

h3.Workaround
# Shutdown Bamboo
# Backup database for rollback purposes
# Select the list of Global Permission data in the table ACL_OBJECT_IDENTITY:
{code:sql}
SELECT * FROM ACL_OBJECT_IDENTITY WHERE OBJECT_ID_IDENTITY=999999 AND OBJECT_ID_CLASS="com.atlassian.bamboo.security.GlobalApplicationSecureObject"
{code}
The above SQL result should only have 1 row
# Delete the duplicate data so that only 1 row is left:
{code:sql}
DELETE FROM ACL_ENTRY WHERE ACL_OBJECT_IDENTITY IN (id1,id2);
DELETE FROM ACL_OBJECT_IDENTITY WHERE ID IN (id1,id2);
{code}
Replace id1,id2 and add any extra ID into the above SQL to delete the duplicate data
# Restart Bamboo

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to save task in Internet Explorer 11
h3. Environment
* Internet Explorer 11 (tested with 11.0.9600.17031)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
h5. SSH and SCP task
# Create a SSH or SCP task in a Job
# Press save

h5. Source Code Checkout, Script task, or NUnit Runner Task
# Create a Source Code Checkout task or Script task in a job
# Press save

h3. Expected Results
Task is saved

h3. Actual Results
h5. SSH and SCP task
The following error is shown in the UI
{noformat}
An unexpected error has occurred
TypeError: Object doesn't support property or method 'startsWith'
{noformat}

h5. Source Code Checkout, Script task, NUnit Runner Task
The save loads indefinitely.

Despite the errors on both scenarios, the changes are still saved.

h3. Workaround
# download [^bamboo.js]
# go to {color:blue}{{<bamboo-install>/atlassian-bamboo/scripts}}{color} and move {color:blue}{{bamboo.js}}{color} onto a different location outside Bamboo's directory
# place [^bamboo.js] onto {color:blue}{{<bamboo-install>/atlassian-bamboo/scripts}}{color}
# clear the IE 11 cache
fields.summary: Can't save task in Internet Explorer 11

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Existing authors should be automatically linked when a new user repository is set in Bamboo

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a linked repository in Bamboo
# Associate this repository to a plan
# Make sure Bamboo don't have any user with this email "user@example.com"
# Create a commit with committer "user" and email "user@example.com"
# Run a build that lists that commit. This will create a new author in Bamboo
# Switch Bamboo to an LDAP user repository that contains a user with the email "user@example.com" (the username don't matter here)

h3. Expected Results
The author should be automatically linked to the user with the email "user@example.com".

h3. Actual Results
The author is not linked when the repository is switched nor when a new commit is registered to a new build.

An author is created every time a commit with a new commiter is registered in a plan build. When a new author is created, Bamboo will automatically link it to a user with the same email, if there is one. As an admin I assume this behavior should be consistent if the user comes from a user repository.

h3.Workaround
Go to *Cog icon >> Security >> Author* page and click *Auto-link unlinked authors* after switching the user repository
fields.summary: Existing authors should be automatically linked when a new user repository is set in Bamboo

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After an upgrade from 5.12.3.1 to 5.14.4.1, Bamboo variable planRepository.branchName is being mapped to the branch full path instead of the branch name for svn repositories.

h3. Environment
Bamboo 5.14.4.1, after being migrated from 5.12.3.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Bamboo 5.12.3.1
# Configure svn repo, with branches.
# Create Task to print ${bamboo.planRepository.branchName}
# Upgrade to version 5.14.4.1
# Run task again

h3. Expected Results
Task printing <branch_name>

h3. Actual Results
Task printing /branch/path/<branch_name>
fields.summary: Variable value changed for svn branch, after Bamboo upgrade 5.12.3.1 - 5.14.4.1

h3. Summary
When Bamboo fail to perform OAuth application link request to Bitbucket Server, it is logging an incorrect error message

# Create Application Link between Bitbucket Server and Bamboo
# Create a Bamboo build plan to build Bitbucket Server repository
# Run the build to check the integration is successfully created
# The build status is showing in Bitbucket Server repository commit list
# Disable the Incoming OAuth authentication from Bitbucket Server side

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Bamboo _Source Code Checkout_ task fails when Repository cache is stored on Windows using Cygwin Git. There has been some changes to Cygwin Git libraries and the way it handles the remote origin path. Bamboo needs to adapt to the recent changes made to Cygwin Git.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Install Bamboo Server or remote agent on a Windows machine using Cygwin Git.
* Instructions on how to install Cygiwn Git here: [Installing GIT on Windows (using Cygwin)|http://redmine.jamoma.org/projects/jamoma/wiki/Installing_and_setting_up_GIT]. If you are installing Cygwin for the first time, don't forget to:
** Add Cygwin to Path (e.g. C:\cygwin64\bin).
** Download all of the packages related to Git and OpenSSH while installing Cygwin.
** Set the remote agent git binary path (e.g. C:\cygwin64\bin\git.exe).

Trigger a manual build with a _Source Code Checkout_ task to download code from your Git repository.
* If you are using remote agents, check the option to enable remote agent caching.

h3. Expected Results

Build will succeed.

h3. Actual Results

Build fails with the following error message:

h3.Workaround

*Bamboo Remote Agents*

If this is happening on a Bamboo remote agent running on a Windows machine:
* Advise users to switch to using [Git for Windows|https://git-for-windows.github.io] as it's more reliable. We've had many problems with the Git implementation for Cygwin in the past and have opted to suggest Git for Windows as it's more stable, as seen on the Bamboo [Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/supported-platforms-289276764.html].
* Don't store the Git cache on the remote agent side. If we store the cache on the Bamboo Server side, it will be handled by the Git distribution installed on the server running Bamboo.


*Bamboo Server*
If this is happening to local agents and Bamboo Server is running on a Windows machine with Cygwin Git, please switch to using [Git for Windows|https://git-for-windows.github.io].
fields.summary: Source Code Checkout fails when Repository cache is stored on Windows using Cygwin Git

fields.description:
*Description*

Bamboo used a version of Struts 2 that was vulnerable to [CVE-2017-5638|https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/WW/S2-045]. Attackers can use this vulnerability to execute Java code of their choice on systems that have a vulnerable version of Bamboo

*Affected versions:*
 * All versions of Bamboo from *5.1.0* before *5.14.5* (the fixed version for 5.14.x) and from *5.15.0* but less than *5.15.3* (the fixed version for 5.15.x) are affected by this vulnerability.

*Fix:*
 * *Bamboo* 5.15.3 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/bamboo/download].
 * *Bamboo* 5.14.5 is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/bamboo/download-archives].

*Hotfix:*
 The preferred fix is to upgrade your Bamboo using one of the links from the *Fix* section. If you cannot schedule an upgrade immediately, you can replace the affected library as a temporary workaround.
 * *Bamboo* 5.9.x, 5.10.x, 5.11.x, 5.12.x - use [^struts2-core-2.3.16.3-atlassian-7.jar]
 * *Bamboo* 5.13.x - use [^struts2-core-2.5.1-atlassian-11.jar] (this jar has struts2 version 2.5.1 with the same fix applied in version 2.5.10.1)

To replace the library, remove the existing struts2-core library from $BAMBOO_DIR/WEB-INF/lib, replace it with one matching your Bamboo version and restart your Bamboo server. This temporary solution is provided only for your convenience and an upgrade to an official Bamboo release should be scheduled as soon as possible.


For additional details see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/_slDN].
fields.summary: Apache Struts 2 Remote Code Execution (CVE-2017-5638)

fields.description:
h3. Purpose
Allow licenses that have elastic remote agent abilities. 

e.g. 
{quote}
We have a bamboo server setup with a 25 agent license and for the most part, that suits our needs. We need more agents, but not the next tier of 100. 

Example:
* From 6:00 am to 11:00 am we need 50 remote agents
* The rest of the day we need 25 that we currently have. 
* What we would like to be able to do is spin up agents in AWS before 6:00 am, use them till 11:00 am then shut those down and go back to just our 25 agents. 
{quote}
fields.summary: Elastic Licenses

fields.description:
In my company we have several deployment projects and each project can have well over 70 environments and growing.

To make life easy we keep them in alphabetical order but creating a new environment can be an absolute chore when it is created at the bottom of the list and needs to be moved 50 times up the list.

The only way to order the environments currently is to select *Actions* then *Move Up* or *Move Down*. It's inefficient for small to large projects and the ordering feature feels like an afterthought.

There needs to be a better way of ordering the deployment environments, for my sanity and for the wear and tear on my mouse hand.
fields.summary: Efficient reordering of deployment environments

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If there is a mistake causing test not executed, Bamboo build will still run successfully without performing the necessary test.

The current notification does show the total number of tests but it does not highlight that the total number of test has reduced.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have a special notification to highlight that the total test number has reduced to alert the user if there is any mistake in the test number
fields.summary: Add a Special Notification to update user about total test number reduced

fields.description:
Hello,

I have created a Build Plan and plan branches. When I click on Build Plan and go to Issues Tab or click on Plan Branches and go to Issues Tab, I don't see the linked issue. I created branch from JIRA Interface i.e. Create branch which created the branch with the JIRA Key. Hence the plan branches have the Issue Key. I had to manually link the JIRA Issue
fields.summary: Jira issue is not automatically linked to a plan

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to Deploy -> Deployment dashboards
# Create a new deployment dashboard
# Try to delete the deployment dashboard

Step 3 will fail because there is no UI buttons/menu items to delete it.

h3. Workaround

It is possible to delete it via the REST API:

# Find out the ID of the deployment dashboard you want to delete by looking at its URL.
# Run the following curl command, replacing "123" with your deployment dashboard's ID:
{noformat}
$ curl -u $USER:$PASSWORD -X DELETE https://BAMBOO_HOST/rest/deployment/1.0/dashboards/123
{noformat}
fields.summary: Deployment dashboards cannot be deleted

fields.description:
h1. Summary
Bamboo should be able to handle null values in builds after upgrade

h1. Workaround
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMKB/After+upgrade%2C+fail+to+create+deployment+release
fields.summary: Bamboo doesn't handle null Variables values of existing builds after upgrade

fields.summary: NullPointerException when open build dashboard in heavy loaded instance

fields.description:
h1. Summary

Bamboo runs permission validation against random plan when execute report
h1. Details

When execute report generator Bamboo checks if user has READ permission to plan. Sometimes it checks it against another plan

User mode
 # Create 2 plans Plan1 and Plan2 in same project. And execute them once
 # Create 2 users User1 and User2 in bamboo-user group (create group if necessary)
 # Change Plan1 permissions and add User1 with View permission, remove View permission from Anonymous and logged in users
 # Change Pla2 permissions and add User2 with View permission, remove View permission from Anonymous and logged in users
 # Login as User1, go to Reports, choose Build Activity report for Plan1
 # See graph with one dot
 # Login as User2, go to Reports, choose Build Activity report for Plan2
 # See warning message !Screen Shot 2017-03-08 at 13.07.13.png|thumbnail!
 # But if you login as admin and choose Plan2 for report you will see graph with one dot

Developer mode
 # Create 2 plans and run their builds
 # Enable DEBUG logging for -com.atlassian.bamboo.resultsummary.search.LucenePermissionChecker- com.atlassian.bamboo.resultsummary.search.IndexedBuildResultsSearcherImpl
 # Open Reports > Reports
 # Choose one of the plan and run Build Activity report
 # see browser URL [http://localhost:9087/bamboo/reports/generateReport.action?reportKey=com.atlassian.bamboo.plugin.system.reports%3AnumberOfBuilds&selectFields=reportKey&labelTarget=&buildIds=3538945&selectFields=buildIds&groupByPeriod=AUTO&selectFields=groupByPeriod&dateFilter=None&selectFields=dateFilter&dateFrom=&dateTo=&save=Submit]
 # See application logs {{2017-03-04 10:48:28,992 DEBUG [http-nio-9087-exec-1] [IndexedBuildResultsSearcherImpl] Permission READ granted for plan with id 3538945}}
 # Choose second plan and run report generator
 # See browser URL and logs, buildIds parameter in URL is not the same as Permission READ validation in logs
fields.summary: Lucene query checks plan permission against random plan

fields.description:
The dialog to add a new executable only has an Add button—it has no Cancel button or other way to exit the dialog without making changes.

To replicate:
# From a project screen, choose Actions > Configure Plan.
# Choose a job, creating one if necessary.
# In the Tasks tab, click the Add task button at the bottom left. In the resulting dialog, choose Command.
# In the Command configuration panel, click Add new executable. There’s no Cancel button.

Please find a screenshot attached.

h3. Workaround
Click Esc button
fields.summary: Command > Add new executable dialog has no cancel button

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If locale setting in the Bamboo Server computer makes the date use a special character, Bamboo will fail to parse the date, returning null.

h3. Environment
Linux with locale settings that use special characters for either days or months.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# In catalina.sh (for Linux), add "user.language=XX" for JAVA_OPTS. For example:
{noformat}
JAVA_OPTS="$JAVA_OPTS $JSSE_OPTS -Duser.language=de -Duser.region=DE"
{noformat}
We are now in March. In german, March is März. The "umlaut" cannot be parsed.
# Run a build. 

h3. Expected results
{noformat}
03-Mar-2017 16:33:55 	JOB1
03-Mar-2017 16:33:55 	going to sleep.
03-Mar-2017 16:33:58 	sleeping done
{noformat}

h3. Actual results
{noformat}
01-Jan-1970 01:00:00 	JOB1
01-Jan-1970 01:00:00 	going to sleep.
01-Jan-1970 01:00:00 	sleeping done
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
# Force tomcat to use english locale:
{noformat}
JAVA_OPTS="$JAVA_OPTS $JSSE_OPTS -Duser.language=en -Duser.region=DE"
{noformat}
fields.summary: Locale setting breaks build log timestamp

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Creating a linked repository to a *Personal* Bitbucket Server repo fails with {{OAuth authentication failed: signature_invalid}}. Project level repositories still work fine. The problem occurs due to the interplay of the encoding of the ~ (tilde) present in the URL for personal repositories when it passes through the reverse proxy in-front of Bitbucket.

h3. Environment
* Confirmed against Bitbucket 4.13, Bitbucket 4.14. Not tested on other versions.
* Bamboo 5.15.0.1
* Bitbucket is behind a reverse proxy

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a personal repository in Bitbucket. *View Profile > Create repository*
# Create a linked repository in Bamboo > Bitbucket Server > Select the personal repository

h3. Expected Results
Able to create linked repository to a personal repository.

h3. Actual Results
The below error is shown in the UI:
{noformat}
An unexpected error has occurred
com.atlassian.applinks.internal.common.auth.oauth.OAuthMessageProblemException: OAuth authentication failed: signature_invalid
{noformat}

h3. Problem Definition
Deployments occassionally get stuck and won't stop until manually stopped.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow for a configuration to kill hung deployments. Similar to the [HungBuildKiller add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.buildeng.hung-build-killer/server/overview]

fields.description:
Hi,

We have plans in Bamboo which automatically creates a tag referenced to the commit of the default repository.

This allows us to reproduce the same artefact by using the field “revision” and filling it with the tag. Obviously, we know that we have the builds in bamboo and if we execute this build we are going to get the same result, but we create the tag and use the revision field in case of having deleted this build (we need to reproduce the same artefact in every case).

At this moment, we want to use several repositories in the same plan following the same process. Using the same tag for each repository.

The problem that we see is there is only one field revision and this field is the hash commit or the tag for the default repository. There is nothing for the rest of the repositories, so we can’t reproduce the same artefact.

Are you going to improve this feature? Do you have planned this in your roadmap?

Thanks.
fields.summary: Field revision and several repositories

fields.description: We have a need to allow development teams to manage build agents, but not deploy code into a production environment.  It would be nice if Bamboo would open up the agents panel to a new role, that still limits full admin access.

fields.description:
As part of the build, we do run a bunch of tests and these tests do stuff on the image and I suspect they leave stuff that interferes with subsequent runs.

I want the ability to configure agents to only run one build.
fields.summary: As an admin I want to configure Elastic Agents to only run one build

fields.description:
h1. Summary
# Create several plans and assign them to some agent
# Change few records in DB table agent_assignment to have executable_id which doesn't have corresponding record in build table
# Open agent assignment page and see updated records were disappear from assignments list
# Try to remove some plan from agent assignment page
# It's removed but other records removed as well

h1. Reason
Code to remove agent assignment removes all assignments for given agent and then iterates over them and create other assignment except removed by user. If it can't recreate existing assignment (plan doesn't exist or user have no permission to given plan/project) it drops remaining records and exits.

h1. Workaround
Remove DB records from agent_assignment table which references to non existing plans. And then functionality should work as expected
List of orphaned records 
{code}
SELECT
  q.title AS agent_name,
  aa.*
FROM agent_assignment aa
  LEFT JOIN build b ON (aa.executable_id = b.build_id AND b.build_type = 'CHAIN')
  LEFT JOIN queue q ON aa.executor_id = q.queue_id
WHERE aa.executable_type = 'PLAN' AND b.build_id IS NULL AND aa.executor_type = 'AGENT'
UNION
SELECT
  q.title AS agent_name,
  aa.*
FROM agent_assignment aa
  LEFT JOIN build b ON (aa.executable_id = b.build_id AND b.build_type = 'JOB')
  LEFT JOIN queue q ON aa.executor_id = q.queue_id
WHERE aa.executable_type = 'JOB' AND b.build_id IS NULL AND aa.executor_type = 'AGENT';
{code}
fields.summary: Exception on agent assignment removal affects other assignments of agent

fields.description:
Currently in Bamboo Search bar, it only searches for whole string terminated by spaces or dash.
Example:
Plan Name: Lorem_Ipsum-Alpha Bravo
This plan name can be searched with:
* Lorem
* Alpha
* Bravo
* Lo
* Bra

The following keywords will not work:
* Ipsum
* Sum
fields.summary: Support substring in the search bar

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Git LFS checkout will fail for any *non-master* branch if the master branch for that repository hasn't already been fetched into the Bamboo git cache (or the git cache has been cleared). This also occurs on remote agents when caching isn't enabled.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Bamboo Plan that uses a source code checkout task to fetch from a git repository with LFS content
 # Ensure the repository is checking out a *non-master* branch
 # Ensure *Plan configuration > Repositories > repository > Advanced options > Enable git lfs support* is enabled
 # Note if this repository has been used in the past, you will need to clear the Bamboo git cache for it at *Bamboo Administration > Overview > Repository settings* first.
 # Run the plan

h3. Expected Results

Checkout completes successfully
h3. Actual Results

The below error is shown in the build log or as error during change detection:
{code:java}
Caused by: com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.RepositoryException: : Cannot fetch branch 'refs/heads/branch' from 'git@bitbucket.org:repo-owner/lfstest.git' to source directory '/var/bamboo-home/xml-data/build-dir/_git-repositories-cache/0334bcb1c6facdb7666ff54b60cdca9e6d2bd69c'. command /usr/bin/git lfs fetch ssh://6f75ebec-a410-486b-b087-5d8c1d0d6a1a@127.0.0.1:45990/repo-owner/lfstest.git failed with code 2. Working directory was [/var/bamboo-home/xml-data/build-dir/_git-repositories-cache/0334bcb1c6facdb7666ff54b60cdca9e6d2bd69c]., stderr:
Could not fetch

Errors logged to /var/bamboo-home/xml-data/build-dir/_git-repositories-cache/0334bcb1c6facdb7666ff54b60cdca9e6d2bd69c/.git/lfs/objects/logs/20170227T131538.452589247.log
Use `git lfs logs last` to view the log.
{code}
LFS log from {{git lfs logs last}} shows:
{noformat}
$ git-lfs fetch ssh://6f75ebec-a410-486b-b087-5d8c1d0d6a1a@127.0.0.1:45990/repo-owner/lfstest.git
Could not fetch

Git can't resolve ref: "HEAD"
{noformat}
h3. Workaround
 * (!) See the second workaround for remote agents when caching isn't enabled

 # Change your repository to clone the master branch and run a build, or create a separate plan that will clone master for the same repository and run a build.
 # Once master has been cloned into the cache, subsequent branch builds will work.

This one could result in a rather long clone for a large LFS repository, but it's an option:
 # Enable _fetch whole repository_ under *Plan configuration > Repositories > repository > Advanced Options*
 # Try the build again. If you have caching enabled, this only needs to be performed once.

If the git cache is cleared for whatever reason (this can happen automatically with some git command failures) and you've used a temporary form of the workaround – you'll need to perform one of the workarounds again.
fields.summary: Git LFS checkout fails for non-master branch when the Bamboo git cache is empty
Prompt should be forwarded to logs

fields.description:
There is unsupported plugin https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.bamboo.plugin.requirementtask/server which was released as workaround for https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-13499. Now it's core Bamboo functionality and people need to migrate data from plugin to Bamboo core.

We should release new version of plugin with upgrade task to migrate data and disable plugin
fields.summary: Migrate Requirements for Deployments plugin data into core Bamboo

fields.description:
h1. Summary
REST call http://localhost:8085/bamboo/rest/api/latest/agent/assignment?executorType=AGENT&executorId=EXECUTOR_ID&assignmentType=PLAN&entityId=ENTITY_ID doesn't check if assignment already exists for agent and entity. It causes UI issues when deleted assignment reappears on screen refresh

h1. Steps to reproduce
# Create 2 plans
# Open agent dedication screen
# Choose build plan and assign it to agent
# Get POST query from browser dev tools and execute it via curl several times. See 200 response from server
# Remove created assignment from UI
# See it was removed from screen
# Refresh page
Expected result: dedication is removed
Actual result: dedication reappears
fields.summary: Agent assignment REST endpoint allows to create duplicates

README should:
* describe plugin
* tell customers how to build it (including link to https://developer.atlassian.com/display/docs/set+up+the+atlassian+plugin+sdk+and+build+a+project)
* we should have common template for this
fields.summary: Add README for bamboo-xcode plugin

fields.description:
We have a very high turn ratio on branches so our branch cleanup is set to 7 days so we have a manageable amount of branches in bamboo. Sometimes priorities change on branches with committed stuff and by the time they come up again they might have been cleaned up from bamboo already.

My request is that even if the branch has been cleaned up/deleted before we want the new commits to reactivate/recreate that branch in bamboo since it is active again so we don't need to wait for the admin to have time to manually recreate it.
fields.summary: recreating branches when they receive new commits

fields.description: When in branch view, I see a bunch of different plans assigned to my branch. I want to temporarily disable plan for branch without removing it and having to find it again when needed.
fields.summary: Branch view - add control to temporarily disable plan for branch

fields.description:
A improvement for Bamboo will be to prompt the user in the UI to disable branch detection for the plan and any plan branches related to it.  While it is possible to work around this by manually changing the detection options, this ideally would be automatic.  A disabled plan (and branches) should be completely disabled. 

Currently this behaviour is defined as expected (BAM-16632) but it is perhaps not clear to most users what the scope of the disablement is. 

This functionally could be enabled/controlled at a global or plan level.
fields.summary: When disabling a plan prompt to also disable branch detection

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When attempting to authenticate with a public GitHub repository by supplying a username and no password, if Git Credential Manager for Windows is installed it will launch an interactive child process in the background that waits for you to enter your GitHub credentials. Since Bamboo is being running the git command for change detection in an automated, non-interactive fashion – this process will never receive the credentials and terminate, so Bamboo will keep the build in the 'queued' state until the configured command timeout on the repository is reached with a log entry similar to the following:

{code}
2017-02-15 01:47:54,686 INFO [9-BAM::PlanExec:pool-16-thread-1] [GitCommandProcessor] Command was canceled: command 'C:\Program Files\Git\cmd\git.exe' ls-remote https://user@github.com/repository-owner/repo.git failed with code -1. Working directory was [.].
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution
# If technically feasible, it'd be fantastic if we could detect that this was occurring and either bypass the credential manager in some fashion or kill the build earlier with an error message.
# We could also get around this by allowing the GitHub plugin to authenticate in an anonymous fashion with a public GitHub repo since this appears to only occur when you authenticate with just a username. Username is a mandatory field in the GitHub plugin. The Bitbucket cloud plugin allows you to choose public access without a username or private.
 
h3. Workaround 
# First check to see if any credentials have been stored for the repository under *Windows Control Panel > Credential Manager > Generic Credentials*. Depending on previous authentication attempts, sometimes the credential manager can store just the username here and all subsequent attempts will launch the interactive git-credential-manager.exe with the GitHub login prompt UI – so it's best to clear this entry first.
# From command-line, run a git command to the repo. I.E: {{git ls-remote https://user@github.com/repository-owner/repo.git}}
# When prompted for a password, enter it. This will store your user/pass in the credential vault and it won't prompt for it again when the same command is executed from Bamboo.
# Alternatively, you can also add your password to the repository configuration in Bamboo to bypass the credential manager prompt.

Another workaround: Instead of using a GitHub type repository in Bamboo to access a public repository, you can use a repository of type 'Git' and point it to the public GitHub URL. The difference being that in the GitHub repository in Bamboo, the Username is a mandatory field, so you cannot authenticate with a public repository anonymously as you can with the Git repository.
fields.summary: Git Credential Manager for Windows can cause Bamboo to queue the build until command timeout when authenticating with a public GitHub repository

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It would be very nice to have the ability to bulk add Bitbucket Server repositories to Bamboo either using a REST endpoint or through the UI to tighten up the integration between the applications even more. This would save a lot of time when connecting Bamboo with Bitbucket Server as some of them have hundreds and even thousands of repositories. Have the ability to bulk add them to Bamboo so they're ready to be used/associated to any build plans would be great.

 h3. Notes

Currently this is a very manual process. Once Bamboo is linked up to Bitbucket Server, users have to access Bamboo and create each one of the repository configurations manually.
fields.summary: Ability to bulk add Bitbucket Server repositories

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On a successful build, Bamboo doesn't include the merge commit in build status sent to Bitbucket Cloud after a branch updater build. The commit hash to attribute the build status to is only for the commit that's checked out before the branch updater merges changes in and does not include the merge commit from the push. 

This creates a scenario where the PR cannot be merged if you have a restriction in Bitbucket Cloud that your PR cannot be merged without a successful build from Bamboo until another build is run. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup a Bamboo plan using a Bitbucket Cloud Repository
# Enable branch updater to merge changes from master into current branch and push on successful build
# Create two additional branches: branch1 & branch2
# Commit to both branch1 & branch2
# Create a PR for branch1 and merge it to master
# Make an additional commit to branch2, *after* the PR for branch1 is merged to master
# Create a PR for branch2
# Bamboo will automatically build the additional commit to branch2, merge the changes in from master and push on successful build

h3. Expected Results
Push a build status for the merge commit so PR can be merged.

h3. Actual Results
No build status will be present for the merge commit from master on branch2. Since this is the most recent commit, the PR cannot be merged if there is a restriction on requiring a successful build before merge.

h3.Workaround
* Build needs to be re-run a second time so that a build status is sent for the most recent commit.
fields.summary: Bamboo doesn't include merge commit in build status sent to Bitbucket Cloud after branch updater build

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Exclude changeset feature doesn't with JGIT (no git capability set)

h3. Environment
Bamboo on Linux OS server
Oracle java JDK set

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure no git capability is set in Bamboo server
# Create a linked repository of Bitbucket Cloud type
# Configure the following regex in the {{Exclude changesets}} field:
{noformat}
^foo.*$
{noformat}
# Create a plan and associate the above repository to this plan
# Make sure there is a trigger configured for this plan
# Commit new changes in the repository with the following commit message:
{noformat}
foo bar
{noformat}


h3. Expected Results
No builds are triggered
If a manual build is run, no commits starting with "foo" should show up in the build results

h3. Actual Results
The build is triggered
The build result shows the commit in the commits tab


h3.Workaround
Install an external git in Bamboo server and add it as a capability in Bamboo
fields.summary: Exclude changeset feature doesn't work with JGIT (no git capability set)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the Bamboo logs the pre-bootstrap tasks have names such as:
{noformat}
4300 : Make sure there's single row in HIBERNATE_UNIQUE_KEY table
...
51010 : Check if lucene index root dir exists
...
51012 : Make sure that MySQL server uses InnoDB engine for tables
...
{noformat}
These names may be confusing for the user that reads the logs. The messages may suggest actions
that the user should make in their Bamboo instance.

h3. Suggested Solution


The names of the pre-bootstrap tasks can be changed for example to:
{noformat}
4300 : Ensuring that there's single row in HIBERNATE_UNIQUE_KEY table
...
51010 : Verifying if the lucene index root dir exists
...
51012 : Ensuring that MySQL server uses InnoDB engine for tables
...
{noformat}
fields.summary: Improve the names of the Bamboo pre-bootstrap tasks

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Artifact is not copying empty folders. This behavior is recent since it was working in Bamboo 5.14.1
h3. Environment

The Bamboo instances tested were running in Linux

Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a plan with two stages
 # The first stage will do the following:
 ## Create the folder structure with some files:{code}
mkdir -p a/\{b1,b2,b3}/\{c1,c2}/d
touch a/b1/test_b1
touch a/b1/c1/test_c1
{code}
 ## Create a shared artifact with the following copy pattern:
 ## {code}
**/a/**
{code}
 # The second stage will just download the artifact

h3. Expected Results

The following structure is observed:

{code}
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	.
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	├── a
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	│   ├── b1
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	│   │   ├── c1
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	│   │   │   ├── d
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	│   │   │   └── test_c1
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	│   │   ├── c2
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	│   │   │   └── d
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	│   │   └── test_b1
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	│   ├── b2
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	│   │   ├── c1
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	│   │   │   └── d
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	│   │   └── c2
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	│   │       └── d
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	│   └── b3
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	│       ├── c1
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	│       │   └── d
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	│       └── c2
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	│           └── d
{code}
h3. Actual Results

Only the folders with content are copied:
{code}
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	.
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	└── a
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	    └── b1
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	        ├── c1
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	        │   └── test_c1
17-Feb-2017 08:34:57	        └── test_b1
{code}

The same test was performed in Bamboo 5.14.1 and the whole structure is returned (Artifact definition covers the empty folders).

h3. Workaround
 # Create an artifact with the whole content that should be covered by the artifact
 # Publish this archive as the artifact
 # Download the artifact in the next stage
 # Unzip the artifact archive downloaded
fields.summary: Artifact is not copying empty folders

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using shared credentials to perform checkouts, if using jgit instead of native git the checkouts fail

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Bamboo 5.15
# Make sure native git is not installed and jgit is being used
# Create shared credentials and use these to set up a linked repository
# Perform a checkout


h3. Expected Results
The checkout should succeed

h3. Actual Results
The checkouts fail with errors like the following: {code:title=atlassian-bamboo.log}
2017-02-17 08:31:43,823 INFO [9-BAM::PlanExec:pool-16-thread-1] [DefaultErrorHandler] Recording an error: Unable to detect changes : PROJ-PLAN : : ssh://git@mycompany.org:7999/proj/repo.git: Auth fail
{code} {code:title=atlassian-bamboo.log}
2017-02-17 13:05:59,990 INFO [9-BAM::PlanExec:pool-16-thread-3] [DefaultErrorHandler] Recording an error: Unable to detect changes : PROJ2-PLAN2 : : https://mycompany.org/scm/proj2/repo2.git: Authentication is required but no CredentialsProvider has been registered
2
{code}

h3.Workaround
Install native git or use SSH key with passphrase
fields.summary: jgit can't check out using shared credentials

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In 5.15 the public method in the com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.git.GitHubRepository class changed from getEncryptedPassword() to getPassword(), which is a backwards-incompatible change.

[GitHubRepository (Atlassian Bamboo 5.14.4.1 API)|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-bamboo/5.14.4.1/com/atlassian/bamboo/plugins/git/GitHubRepository.html#getEncryptedPassword--]

[GitHubRepository (Atlassian Bamboo 5.15.0.1 API)|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-bamboo/5.15.0.1/com/atlassian/bamboo/plugins/git/GitHubRepository.html#getPassword--]


Causes issues with some plugins.
* https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.mhackner.bamboo-github-status/server/overview
fields.summary: 5.15 API Changes for GitHubRepository class not backwards compatible

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Changing the "Repository Host" of an existing Linked Repository to "Stash" in {{Administration >> Linked Repositories}} does not list the Stash hosts
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add Application link to Stash/Bitbucket Server on Bamboo 5.9.x
 # Create and save a linked repository with host "Git"
 # Edit the linked repository
 # Change the Host to "Stash"

h3. Expected Results

Linked Stash/Bitbucket Server servers appear in "Stash server" list
h3. Actual Results

"No matches" found is shown in "Stash server" list
h3. Workaround

 # Click "Save repository" – the page will refresh and load the linked Stash servers
 # Continue configuring Stash repository

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As in a feature request [Support IPv6|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-14256], we don't support IPv6 on Bamboo at this moment.
 In [some Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/14815271/problem-that-bamboo-hook-call-appends-00000001-to-any-ip], there seems to be some mentions about it. However, there isn't in our official docs.
h3. Suggested Solution

We should announce it on our official docs like [Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/supported-platforms-289276764.html], [System Requirements|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/bamboo-best-practice-system-requirements-388401170.html] as well.
fields.summary: Documentation about IPv6

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* When adding a capability to Bamboo remote agent from UI, othe view /admin/agent/viewAgent.action?agentId=AGENT_ID gets slow to render.
* Performance issues for {{/admin/agent/viewAgent.action?agentId=AGENT_ID}} in general, not just adding a capability.

h3. Environment
* Bamboo v5.14.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# go to {{Bamboo administration >> Agents >> [Online|Offline] remote agents >> REMOTE_AGENT}}
# add a new capability under {{Add capability}}
||Capability type|Custom|
||Key|foo|
||Value|bar|
# click on {{Add}}

h3. Expected Results
* View /admin/agent/viewAgent.action?agentId=AGENT_ID should load without any delays

h3. Actual Results
* View can take minutes to be displayed depending on the amount of data being loaded.

h3. Notes
* Slowness will depend on the amount of data entries to be queries against a few tables in database, so data can be populated on:
|Capabilities|Executable jobs|Executable deployment environments|System properties|Audit logs|System erros|

h3. Workaround
* Reduce the amount of records to be queries  by running Bamboo Expiry, so you can have some improvement.
fields.summary: Adding capability using Bamboo UI to a Remote Agent is slow

fields.description:

# Start MySQL version 5.6.29
# Configure Bamboo 5.14.3.1 to connect to MySQL

h3. Expected Results
Bamboo will connect to MySQL without any error

h3. Actual Results
Bamboo manage to connect to MySQL but the below exception is thrown in the atlassian-bamboo.log file:
{noformat}
2017-02-15 15:59:55,949 INFO [performSetupDatabaseConnectionBackgroundThread] [AbstractUpgradeManager] -------------------------------------------
2017-02-15 15:59:55,949 INFO [performSetupDatabaseConnectionBackgroundThread] [AbstractUpgradeManager] 51111 : Verify DB compatibility (bootstrap)

2017-02-15 15:59:55,950 ERROR [performSetupDatabaseConnectionBackgroundThread] [DatabaseIsSupported] Detected MYSQL version [MySQL] 5.6.0 (5.6.29-log), minimal supported version is 5.6.3

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Executable dropdown in task configuration does not contain builder executable if a different type exists with same label. Example, if we have:
* Command executable labelled 'Visual Studio 2015': {{system.builder.command.Visual Studio 2015}}
* Visual Studio executable labelled 'Visual Studio 2015': {{system.builder.devenv.Visual Studio 2015}}

Visual Studio 2015 will not be selectable within the Visual Studio task.

It may also affect other executables, such as Maven. E.g. having the same label for a Maven 2 and Maven 3 capability:
{code}
system.builder.mvn3.Maven 3.3.9
system.builder.mvn2.Maven 3.3.9
{code}

This is not re-createable under all circumstances as it appears to be dependent on the order of rows returned to the database which is unreliable across DBMS.

h3. Environment
* MS SQL (The bug is likely DBMS agnostic, but it's just easy to have a reproduction use case due to the row ordering on MS SQL)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using a Bamboo database on MS SQL:
# *Bamboo Administration > Overview > Server Capabilities > Add capability*
{code}
Capability type: Executable
Type: Command
Label: Visual Studio 2015
Path: c:
{code}
# *Bamboo Administration > Overview > Server Capabilities > Add capability*
{code}
Capability type: Executable
Type: Visual Studio
Label: Visual Studio 2015
Path: c:
{code}
# *Plan Configuration > Job > Add Task > Visual Studio*
# Select executable dropdown -- EMPTY

h3. Expected Results
The capability is present for the entry:
{code}
Capability type: Executable
Type: Visual Studio
Label: Visual Studio 2015
Path: c:
{code}

h3. Actual Results
No executables are present in the dropdown (duplicate labels can result in an empty executable dropdown)

h3.Workaround
Remove any command capabilities that share a duplicate label with a specific typed builder capability (e.g. Visual Studio, Grails, etc)

The below SQL query may help you verify the presence of other capabilities with the same label but different builders to confirm if this bug is affecting you and where/which agent the conflicting capabilities may come from. Replace *Maven 3.3.9* with the capability label that is now showing up:
{code}
select *
from CAPABILITY c
left outer join CAPABILITY_SET cs on (c.CAPABILITY_SET = cs.CAPABILITY_SET_ID)
left outer join QUEUE q on q.CAPABILITY_SET = cs.CAPABILITY_SET_ID
where KEY_IDENTIFIER LIKE '%Maven 3.3.9';
{code}
* The label is the last segement of the capability key. E.g. in {{system.builder.mvn3.Maven 3.3.9}} the label is {{Maven 3.3.9}}
* The builder is anything before it. E.g. in {{system.builder.mvn3.Maven 3.3.9}} the builder is {{system.builder.mvn3}}
fields.summary: Bamboo executable dropdown in task configuration does not contain builder executable if a different type exists with same label

fields.description:
h4. Problem
Bamboo perform some actions like change detection and merges (when configured) before starting the build. It would be nice to have more feedback on what is being done at those moments. Some users get confused by the lack of UI feedback and they think the build is hanging when it is actually in progress.

h4. Suggestions
* Add a new icon showing Bamboo is performing pre-build tasks (checkout, update, merge etc)
* If possible show any type of progress bar or other UI visual feedback that can show if there is a real progress of estimation of finishing the pre-build stage
* Show any errors like merge or checkout errors in the *Logs* tab. Merge errors are shown in the *Summary* tab and this is not where the users usually try to find the error. They see the failed build icon errors and try to find this information in the logs tab, but there is nothing there when merge errors occur
fields.summary: Increase the UI feedback of background actions prior to build start

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When adding a LDAP user to Global or Plan permissions, the name is not case (UPPERCASE, lowercase, camelCase) validated resulting in the permission not being granted.
h3. Environment
 * Bamboo v5.14.x
 * Windows Active Directory
 * OpenDJ/DS
 * OpenLDAP

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a LDAP user with an UPPERCASE username (e.g. {{MYUSER}}).
 # Synchronise LDAP with Bamboo making use of {{atlassian-user.xml}} and/or {{atlassian-user-custom.xml}} (see [Integrating Bamboo with LDAP|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Integrating+Bamboo+with+LDAP] documentation).
 # Go to {{Bamboo administration >> Security >> Users}} and search for {{MYUSER}} just to confirm successful import into Bamboo.
||  (i)  |Validate user against database:{code:sql}
select * from EXTERNAL_ENTITIES;
+---------+-----------------+------+
| ID      | NAME            | TYPE |
+---------+-----------------+------+
| 2490369 | MYUSER          | EXT  |
+---------+-----------------+------+
{code}|

 # Go to {{Bamboo administration >> Security >> Global permissions}} or {{Plan configuration >> Permissions}}, select the "Add user" button, and type in the username {{MYUSER}} with a different case, e.g. {{myuser}}, and select "Add".
||  (i)  |Validate user's plan permission against database:{code:sql}
select PROJECT.TITLE PROJECT_TITLE,
       B.TITLE PLAN_TITLE,
       B.FULL_KEY PLAN_KEY,
       AE.SID USERNAME,
       AE.MASK
  from ACL_ENTRY AE
  join ACL_OBJECT_IDENTITY AOI on AE.ACL_OBJECT_IDENTITY = AOI.ID
  join BUILD B on AOI.OBJECT_ID_IDENTITY = B.BUILD_ID
  join PROJECT on B.PROJECT_ID = PROJECT.PROJECT_ID
 where B.build_type = 'CHAIN'
   and B.FULL_KEY = 'PROJ-PLAN';
+---------------+------------+-----------+----------------+------+
| PROJECT_TITLE | PLAN_TITLE | PLAN_KEY  | USERNAME       | MASK |
+---------------+------------+-----------+----------------+------+
| Project       | Plan       | PROJ-PLAN | myuser         |    1 |
| Project       | Plan       | PROJ-PLAN | myuser         |    2 |
| Project       | Plan       | PROJ-PLAN | myuser         |   64 |
| Project       | Plan       | PROJ-PLAN | myuser         |  128 |
| Project       | Plan       | PROJ-PLAN | myuser         |   16 |
+---------------+------------+-----------+----------------+------+
{code}|

h3. Expected Results

{{myuser}} should have access to 'PROJ-PLAN' as per described above.

h3. Actual Results
{{myuser}} does not have permissions over 'PROJ-PLAN' because {{MYUSER}} (_EXTERNAL_ENTITIES table_) differs from {{myuser}} (_ACL_ENTRY table_) 

h3. Notes
When Bamboo's user repository is selected as {{Local users and groups}}, by typing in a username, Bamboo:
 * Searches against its internal directory checking if user exists and
 ** if user is found, it displays the user's name below the input field.
|  (!)  |However, this same validation does not happen when {{Custom user repository}} is selected under {{Bamboo administration >> Security >> User repositories}} letting case insensitive entries be entered|

h3. Workaround

When granting permissions, the username must be typed in using the same case as it is in LDAP / the same case displayed in {{Bamboo administration >> Security >> Users}}.
fields.summary: LDAP User is not case validated when granting permissions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently to enable profiling in Bamboo it requires you to shutdown Bamboo and add {{-Datlassian.profile.activate=true}} to the JVM arguments. When troubleshooting performance issues, it is often not ideal for administrators to shutdown their Production instance to enable additional logging.

h3. Suggested Solution
UI configuration or endpoint we can hit to enable profiling without shutting down Bamboo, similar to Bitbucket would be ideal.
fields.summary: Endpoint or UI configuration to enable performance Profiling in Bamboo

fields.description:
h3. Summary
With Bitbucket Server linked to Bamboo, the polling branch detection still runs.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link Bamboo to Bitbucket Server (version 4.0+)
# Enable branch detection
# Configure 300s interval for Branch detection in {{Administration >> Overview >> General configuration}}

h3. Expected Results
Polling branch detection does not run, and branch detection only responds to changes sent from Bitbucket Server.

h3. Actual Results
Polling does run at the configured interval, and branch detection responds to changes sent from Bitbucket Server as well.

h3. Notes
While this is a bug in Bamboo, all Bamboo versions are susceptible to this if they are integrated with a version of Bitbucket 4.0+.

h3.Workaround
While there is no way to disable the branch detection polling behavior, since we know excessive polling branch detection if you have a large number of repositories can contribute to performance issues -- you can safely increase the *Bamboo Administration > Overview > General Configuration > Global Branch Detection Interval* to a higher value to reduce the impact. Bitbucket branches will still be detected in a timely fashion regardless of this value due to the event based notification from Bitbucket. *Please be aware that if you do this and have other types of repositories such as Git / SVN, this will effect branch detection speed.*
fields.summary: Polling branch detection runs even with Bitbucket Server application link added

# create a new user and associate user with group above

# set up permissions
||Bamboo administration >> Global Permissions||
||Groups||Access||Create plan||Create repository||Admin||
|bamboo-plan|(/)|(x)|(x)|(x)|
||Plan configuration >> Permissions||
||Groups||View||Edit||Build||Clone||Admin||
|bamboo-plan|(x)|(x)|(x)|(x)|(/)|

fields.description:
Occasionally we have problems with the JUnit parser unable to parse the XML file, most of the time because the test runner did somehow add some unwanted output to the XML making it invalid and thus unparseable. 

Trying to find the reason for that is difficult, because we have the "Clean working directory after each build" option activated for that job, so there is no way to look into that invalid file afterwards. 

It would be very helpful, if the parser could put the contents of the XML file into the logs in case of a parsing failure. Or maybe allow that as an option.

h3. Summary
After deleting an add-on, the requirement in build plans still exist and can't be removed

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install this addon: https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.bamboo.plugin.requirementtask/server/overview

# Delete the add-on from Bamboo

h3. Expected Results
The requirement in the build plan is auto removed or it can be edited

h3. Actual Results
The requirement in the build plan still exist and can't be deleted

h3.Workaround
# Shutdown Bamboo
# Backup database for rollback purposes
# Run the following SQL to fix it:
{code:sql}
UPDATE REQUIREMENT SET READONLY_REQ=0 WHERE PLUGIN_MODULE_KEY IS NULL; 
{code}
# Restart Bamboo
# The requirement can be deleted now

h3. Summary

Bamboo will not successfully clear an existing database when importing on the same version. This is *not* an upgrade.
h3. Environment

Bamboo 5.10.3. 
 JDBC driver for Microsoft SQL Server version 6.0
 MS SQL Server 2012

 

Expected Results

Database should be completely dropped and recreated.

 

Actual Results

There are a number of errors
 SQL Error: 2627, SQLState: 23000
 complaining that various constrains are preventing inserts.
h3. Workaround

The following needed to be run manually to correctly allow the upgrade
{code:sql}
 alter table CHAIN_STAGE drop constraint FKB613CFC0D96054AC
 alter table PLAN_VCS_LOCATION drop constraint FKB7FED5E45D12BC14
 alter table CHAIN_STAGE_RESULT drop constraint FKC07B17C433C66FC{code}

fields.description:
*Improvement*

Currently, if a symbolic link is included in an artifact, the file that the link points to will be added rather than the link itself.  If the symbolic link points to nothing the file wont be added at all.

Some artifacts will be deployed where the preservation of a link would be a valid choice. 

An improvement for Bamboo could be to implement the option of preserving of symbolic links, similar to tars -H or -L.

Use an underlying tool such as tar to bundle the files and preserve the link structure.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using Bitbucket Cloud as a repository in Bamboo, Bamboo sends a POST request to Bitbucket upon completion of a build to update the build status of those commits. This POST request contains the URL of the Bamboo instance that completed the build so that it can link back to the build result. 

Upon changing the base URL of the instance and performing a new build, this request still contains the previous base URL until Bamboo is restarted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a plan that uses a Bitbucket Cloud repository
# Build the plan
# Check the commits in the Bitbucket Cloud repository and the URL behind the build status link
# (Optional) Make a new commit to the repository for comparability of the URL (this actually updates if you build the same commit, so not necessary)
# Now change the base URL in *Bamboo Administration > Overview > General Configuration*
# Build the plan again
# Check the commits in Bitbucket Cloud and the URL behind the build status link -> still the old base URL

h3. Expected Results
Bitbucket Cloud links to the new base URL.

h3. Actual Results
Bitbucket Cloud still links to the old base URL.

h3. Notes
* It's important to note, even after Bamboo is sending the correct URL to Bitbucket the build status for past commits / builds will not point to the new instance -- you will need to build the plan again for the URL to be updated.
* You can set TRACE / ALL logging on the following classes to inspect request contents:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.bitbucket.impl.BitbucketApiServiceImpl
com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.bitbucket.events.BitbucketBuildStatusUpdater
{noformat}
 

h3.Workaround
# Restart Bamboo after changing the base URL so that the new URL is used instead.
fields.summary: Old Base URL sent to Bitbucket Cloud when updating build status from Bamboo
